transcript.content: Eminem, Lose Yourself on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant, but not Karl Pilkington.
No, Karl, no.
He's gone back to 'Manchester Innit'. 'It's better than London. You don't know it! You don't know it! Manchester's better than London.' Instead Claire Sturgess.
Claire Sturgess, round of applause for Clare, yeah.
Ricky claps.
Thanks, yeah, thanks.
She's come in in the sort of camoflauge gear ... is that quite trendy? Is that what the kids are wearing?
D'you know, it's funny, someone actually mentioned to me ...
Or are are on maneuvers?
I am actually, yeah, taking time out this morning from what I normally do.
Sure.
I missed the ... erm ... second half, talking about that, of Celebrity Boot Camp.
I don't know what that is.
Coolio ... the fella from Milli Vanilli.
What, the one that's not dead?
Eh?
No, the one that killed himself Steve.
Sure.
Claire laughs.
I just wanted to clarify for people, a lot of people don't realise that one of them is dead. I thought it was important to mention it.
Actually, d'ya know, I didn't know.
No ...
It was a piece of interesting Milli Vanilli trivia that I had and I wanted to slip it in.
It isn't really trivia, because it was a question ... you went 'what, the one who's not dead?'
What I'm saying is that I could have found a more tactful way of bringing up the death of one of Milli Vanilli, because I think there's a lot of people out there who are now upset.
Actually, yeah, people who didn't know ...
That's quite a shock, I didn't ... I should've sat people down.
Who died? Vanilli or Milli?
I think it was ... it was Milli.
No it's Vanilli.
I don't know ...
No but I didn't know ... I'm guessing, actually I'm guessing.
I'm not confusing Milli Vanilli and Scritti Polliti am I?
Ricky laughs.
Because that is a danger.
You're thinking of the fella out of Grumple Palumple.
Steve laughs.
He was amazing.
He was amazing, it's a great shame that he topped himself.
Yeah, Grumple Palumple ... they're not with us.
Anyway, erm, cor, we've got some great tunes lined up. We're gonna play, today, erm, our favourite singles of the year.
Well, it's favourite tunes, some of which didn't quite make it as singles maybe, but tunes of the year cos obviously christmas is very soon, and we'll be away for a short time.
I think next week we'll be doing our favourite christmas songs of all time.
Yeah I'm worried that we're not gonna fill two hours with that, I mean how many times can you play Shakin Stevens before ...
And 'Fairytale of New York'.
Yeah exactly, that's the only one isn't it really.
That's the best one, that's the best Christmas song.
That one's good, but obviously there's Joni Mitchell's 'The River', that starts with a kinda Christmassy feel.
Beautiful, beautiful.
I'm wondering if there's anything else ... not a great deal.
The Waitresses - Christmas Wrapping.
Is that one?
Is that brilliant? Is that good?
Er ... 'So This is Christmas', John Lennon. Paul McCartney came out with 'Simply Having a Wonderful Christmas Time'.
Yeah, but John's was 'Happy Christmas War is Over'.
Yeah.
Of course, it wasn't.
Eh, but I mean, at least he wanted it to be.
Yeah, at least he's dreaming of it, dreaming of it, bless 'im.
And to show ...
John Lennon's dead as well, I don't know anyone's aware of that as well, just another bit of rock and roll trivia.
I like John's protest against war, he stayed in bed for a week. I've been doing that, I've been protesting against war for ages. I'm eating hamburgers against war.
Steve laughs.
Yeah ...
I went into Burger King on the way here, I went up to the counter ...
Let's not ... that's not product placement there. There's a number of other burger joints that people may wish to go to
I often go to McDonalds. I often go to McDonalds.
Erm ... but I went into Burger King, 'cos it's close, and I went in there ...
It's convinient, but often
McDonald's would be convenient.
McDonald's is just convenient, depends where you are.
Just as convenient, depending where you are.

Um, and I said err, I said can I have a cheeseburger and small fries. Takeaway please. And he recognised me, he went, "Oh I've seen you on telly. There's your meal sir". I went, "Thanks". He went, he winked and went, "I put large fries in".
Steve and Claire Laugh
Brilliant!
So it's paying off. At last true genius is being rewarded.
But I'm just intrigued to know, because there's been a couple of times where I've been with you and you know we've gone in a restaurant and
Someone's given you a free meal or whatever. It's the way that it's like you don't ask for it, it's just kind of offered. But I don't know what they're expecting in return.
Nothing!
I mean do they think that you'll go away and you'll always think fondly of Chad who works in Burger King?
No! No, I just think they think ooh I dunno.
I'm gonna give him a little treat.
Yeah. I know, I don't like it but then I'm always grateful and I never... But the thing is I'm slightly embarrassed.
Did anyone around you hear what had happened?
No.
Because I imagine their resentment, just the whole room turning on you.
No they didn't, I had to go round telling them! I went up and said, "Excuse me,
Did you hear that? He just gave me the free thing because I'm on the telly". And they went, "I don't recognise you". I went, "You don't recognise me?.
I'm terrified now that someone could be listening at Burger King HQ. You know, I'm assuming this is an unorthodox procedure.
Oh, and he could get in trouble!
And that little fella got fired.
They know it's Leicester Square now because I just mentioned it. So they know which Burger King it is.
Oh my God. I don't know...
What was his name?
Ralph Littleton. He had a name badge. Number 342.
Claire Laughs
Well I just hope Littleton doesn't get in trouble.
So, uh, what we gonna play first?
That could be a sad Christmas
For him. He's probably keeping his whole family afloat.
Um, bit of Springsteen.
Well, tunes of the year. I mean I know people dismiss Springsteen but as I say the gig I went to see earlier in the year, I made it in the end, it was quite brilliant.
Sturgess couldn't believe we were going to play Springsteen. She was...
I just think, you know, leave aside what you think is cool and trendy and the fact that he's older now.
Really? Really?
Just leave all that behind.
Yeah?
And just listen to the tunes. Because, you know, he remains a great musician.
'Lonesome Day'?
'Lonesome Day', it's the current single and it's the first track on the album.
Free. Free chips.
Steve Chuckles
BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN - LONESOME DAY
That's brilliant.
The boss.
Do we care if it's trendy?
I don't care.
We're like Huey Lewis, it's hip to be square Steve.
It's... That's... It's tr... We should play some Huey.
We can't, can we?
No, no.
Oh, come on. 'The Power Of Love'?
No!
Is a curious thing.
Yeah yeah. Makes one man weep and another man sing. Weird init.
It's bizarre isn't it, it's strange.
Aww flippin' heck.
Yeah, yeah.
Springsteen there.
Yeah, no, obviously he's playing again next year, sometime.
I bet even trendy people thought, "Well yeah, it's alright yeah". I bet they wanted to rock... I bet they wanted to drive along a freeway.
I think you've gotta be hard
Pushed to turn over the channel if you're driving and that's playing. Who wouldn't want to be driving a car while that's playing? Down an open freeway.
We are sounding... I know there's a little bit of irony in it but we are sounding like Doctor Fox. Did you see?! Did. You. See. The final of, um, 'Fame Academy'?
Now I don't watch 'Fame Academy'. I don't, I'm...
Foxy got in there, he was in the audience.
Really?!
No!
How did Foxy get in...
It's not enough being on 'Pop Idol', he's in there! And, do you know who was sitting next to him?
Next to Foxy.
In disguise.
In disguise?
In disguise. He had a little, a
Little beard and a woolly hat on. Looked like 'Badly Drawn Boy'. Mackenzie Crook.
Really?
And we had to, we taped it...
No.
Yeah, yeah. And I went, "It is". We taped it and he was there. So he's back from America and he...
Was it obviously a felt false beard?
No, no, I think he's...
Has he befriended Foxy?
I don't know!
Are they hanging out together now?
We're going to see him tonight. We're going to see him tonight.
What was he doing in the States then? What was he doing?
He's doing films.
He probably is wearing a beard. He plays... We can't say too much about it... He's playing a pirate I think.
Yeah. Yeah.
Ooh he'd make a good pirate.
Yeah, exactly. So far he's been cast as a pirate and a ghost. Which seems to make sense.
Oh, dear.
I'll be pumping him for information about Foxy because, you know, I'm a big fan of Foxy as you know.
I know.
Both a DJ and a medical man .
I like the, I like the way that you got pumping and Foxy in the same sentence.
Yeah, yeah, absolutely. Yeah.
I'd love to-
Did you just say you're going to see him tonight? Is it the comedy awards tonight?
Yeah.
Yeah, its the big 'Do'.
You're going obviously.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
What you wearing? What you wearing?
"What you wearing?"
Steve chuckles
Very boring I'm afraid.
What?
Very traditional tuxedos.
Tuxedos.
We went shopping together and bought them. It's quite sad I don't know if I should have said that.
Claire laughs
Lost a certain degree of rock-and-roll cool.

It was funny, because I went in and I went "42 chest, 36, 30 leg, that's fine right". Steve, right, then I had to stay there looking at Steve try on about nine jackets so the arms weren't too short. I suggested at one point going down to London Zoo and seeing what the gibbons wear because every single-
Those jackets you see them wear when there's an organ grinder.
Ricky laughs
Now who's making those?
Six foot nine. Oh dear.
Have you got the cummerbunds and things?
Well this is the thing, my father phoned up, you know I have conversations with my parents which are always, they'll phone up and it'll be like "alright how's it going? What you having for tea?"
Ricky laughs
"What am I having for tea? I'll probably have spaghetti Bolognese tonight dad." "Oh yeah" "What have you had dad?" "Ah your mother just made a lovely lasagne Steve"
Ricky laughs
I mean it literally, that's the conversation, its like yeah, every parent they're just interested in food. Food that you've eaten, food you're planning to eat, food you've enjoyed in the past.

Because they just want to know you're eating. "Have you got enough vitamin C? Got enough vitamin C tablets, because I can always send you some?" "I can buy them myself dad" "I'll send you some its not a problem" "Dad I don't need to". So anyway he says "What have you done?" and I'm trying to think and I think to myself he'll be impressed if I bought a tuxedo, I say I bought a tuxedo."
Will he like that?
He said "You bought a tuxedo, why didn't you rent it?" I said well it was quite cheap. He went "How cheap?". Told him the price, he went "Its not bad, not bad...
Steve imitates his dad shouting across to another room
"ELAINE, HE JUST BOUGHT A TUXEDO, HE JUST BOUGHT A TUXEDO ELAINE, YEP."
He said "Have you got a cummerband?"
Cummerbund.
A cummerbund. I said "do I need a cummerbund?". He said "Well...you gonna be dancing?"
Ricky and Claire laugh
Like he knows the rules.
Like he knows, like he's some kind of like, I don't think the man's ever worn a suit let alone a tuxedo, what does he know about "gonna be dancing?"
I love your dad.
I just love the idea of him being at some kind of do and "right Elaine, jackets off, cummerbunds on, time for a dance".
You know a cummerbund? You wear it over your braces? Because those things are, because you're not wearing a belt I assume.
No, you wear it under the braces I think.
No you don't.
No, do you? I don't know.
You wear it over it don't you.
Over the belt but braces are a different thing.
There's no belt. No belt on a tuxedo is there?
No you're right, no it is over the braces.
Sorry, how many people tuned to XFM are worrying about the etiquette of cummerbunds?
No, no, but this is important because the comedy awards which is going on, its live tonight.

I tell you this Rick, I tried on the tuxedo I bought yesterday, I got a new shirt as well, I look like James Bond. I'm not going to lie to you, no I do look like James Bond. I look exactly like him, its uncanny, it is uncanny.
Really? Because the bloke in there said you like a.
Lanky streak of piss and I looked good.
(laughs) No-no-no-no-no- cause when--
No he did! he did! he did!
Because as you were walking out the shop he called me back in and said, you know that... fat man on the telly--
No! That was for show, that was for show! Because when the very last time, when you were definitely-- you were definitely!--
He said you looked like Oddjob. He said you looked like Oddjob!
Claire laughs
He said you looked like Blofeld! He said you looked like--
No he nev!-- No, you were definitely on the tube!--
He said you looked like Blojob, he said you looked like Blojob!
He said you looked like a lanky streak of piss with a stupid gingery-blonde hair and goggle eyes.
He said you looked like a combination of Blofeld and Oddjob-you looked like Blojob, he said Blojob!
He said "he is a lanky... twat!"
He said Blojob!
Ricky chuckles
Richard Ashcroft - Science Of Silence
Richard Ashcroft on XFM 104.9. That- that's in the top five for me, the singles of the year so far.
Mhmm, mhmm...
Errrm well, yeah, we're talking about errm... what were we talking about? Comedy Awards. Your dad. Cummerbund.
My father's cummerbund, he wears it--
I'm sure it is over the braces. I think, you know.
Yeah, Well, if anyone knows that, if anyone knows the err, the kind of rules.
So, are you actually wearing one? Are you actually wearing one?
A cummerbund? Well, I asked, Ricky said no, he said don't bother!
No. No, don't bother.
But then I'm think: What if I dance? What if I do some grooving later?
You shouldn't.
Why not?
Well, I've seen you dance before--
Don't give me that.
No, no--
Don't give me that.
No, no. No, wait, wait, wait, wait. It's not that you're not a good dancer--
That dance you did in The Office- that's your best dancing!
Ricky chuckles
No, it's not that you're not a bad dancer, it's that- that- you- I've seen you hit people in the face with your elbow because--
There's always going to be casualties.
Ricky laughs
Actually Rick- Rick! I remember--
When someone's busting a good move, it's murder on the dancefloor.
I danced with- I danced with Steve!
Have you?
At one of err an indie disco at uni.
There you are! You've never forgotten!
And err.. he's good! he's alright!
I am pretty good aren't I? yeah!
He is actually alright!
I tell you the only problem is because I'm so tall--
You were in the bar, but he was alright.
Because I'm so tall, I do tend to tower like two foot above everyone else and that does make me look slightlyyy--
Freakish??
Claire laughs
Ehhh, I wasn't gonna use that word, but I can see where you coming from.
Yeah.
So I do feel slightly self conscious, so I--
Why don't you hold them? Why don't you carry them, when you're dancing with them? So they're...
Well no but the thing is- because I--
Cause then you could dance with Janette Krankie and still not look too weird.
Sure, sure.
That wouldn't be weird would it? You holding Janette Krankie and dancing with her, would that be weird??
I think we've all had that fantasy.
Ricky laughs

But err- what I tend to do is because I'm conscious that everyone is- kind of- can see me and that I'm sort of, you know, I'm quite visible on the dance floor. What I'll tend to do is maybe dance on any kind of podium that they might have in some of the bigger dance clubs.
Sure.
Or you know, any kind of stage. I just get up there, bust some moves.
Yeah.
Because then it's like, you know, I may as well put myself on public display.
Yeah.
Rather than just people think I'm--
Cause then you're going "Look I know what I look like and I'm proud of it."
Yeah, I know how great I look. You know...
Yeh, yeh.
Yeyeye, nononono! Cause its, you know, that's your opinion if you don't think it. But that's- again, a lot of jealousy. I mean a lot of what you say is jealousy.
He went for the normal shirt, I went for the err- the wing collar. I just thought I might as well.
I do like a wing collar actually, yeah. What about a proper bow-tie?
I bought it all I went a bit berserk. I even bought errm- err- union jack cufflinks cause its the British Comedy Awards.
Nice.
You know what I mean? So...
Who's hosting it this year?
Well "more money than sense" springs to mind.
Ricky laughs
Yeah, yeah! Yeah.
I mean you've got- you're earning so much cash now that you don't know what to do with it aren't you?
Ricky laughs
No I mean I don't know what it is you're spending it on but-
Yeah. I said "how much?" they went- oh I said "not expensive enough."
(laughing) Exactly!
I said "I'm going to give you an extra tenner."
Steve laughs
Errm... Is it true? Talking about err- when his dad- said that and then you told me summat that I find amazing.
Oh err--
Your gran- your--
The thing is yeah it's Christmas

So obviously I've got to go back to- to Bristol. I love to see my family. Uhm, well, yeah, I do, uh but it means I'd see my grandparents who are, you know, brilliant people. I mean, lovely people, but mental--
Ricky laughs.

Utterly mental and- and they've taken now to- they must be sort of 80 a piece and that is quite an old age, but they're fairly good health relatively speaking and uhm, they just spend their time in bed. I mean, that's all they do is- that- that's their profession that's their, they've retired to go to bed and they spend all their time in bed--
I tell you what they're like, they're like that old- got-  they're like that old family in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.
Oh yeah.
Remember how none of them had got up--
Yeah.
For like 25 years.
Yeah.
And they--
You- you said that they go to bed, they go to sleep, but then, when they wake up, what they do is put an extra pillow, so there's slightly more upright--
Yeah.
And that's them in the day in bed.
Right, so that's active.
So, that's their- that's their- that's their daytime.
Yeah.
Yeah. But uhm--
But they get up and cook and stuff.
Well what they- well they mm yeah. Well what they do is they see they've got uhm

They've got about six teeth between them. Uhm, I mean, my grandmother wants false- needs false teeth, but refuses to go and have the old ones extracted and the false teeth fitted. So, she's, she's working with about three or four teeth.
Oh.
Uhm, my grandfather had false teeth given to him during the war.
Wooden ones?
Well it wa- it was plastic teeth on a wooden pallet, right? That sits at the top of the mouth. He's still got the wooden pallet, but most of the teeth have come off.
Claire chuckles.
So there's about four teeth left. Four--
Four false teeth. He's got four- he's got a set of false teeth that make him look like he needs false teeth.
Ricky laughs.
And that's pretty bizarre.
Soup.
Oh.

So the problem is that they have to get up. They get up at 7:00 in the morning to put on say, you know, some beef or lamb whichever they're going to cook. They put it on at 6:00 in the morning, 7:00 in the morning, so that by the time they eat it at 6:00 at night, they can use the phrase. This is what a good meal is for my grandparents, if they can use the phrase, "Oh, that's lovely. That's lovely. You could suck it away".
Claire laughs.
You could suck it away. Who wants that from a roast dinner? You may as well blend it up--
And serve it as a broth.
I don't want that phrase coming from old people without teeth.
No, indeed.
Claire laughs.
Because it remind- it must- it must remind you of your rent boy days.
Exactly. It brings it all flooding back, you know.
Oh. God.
Claire laughs.
(incoherent) - the word.
Exactly.
Ricky, Steve and Claire laugh together.
Should we play a record before we get really disgusting about your grandparents and blowjob--
Yeah. Please, please.
Oh dear.
Worst thing we've said.
We've said the word blowjob far too many times today.
And with- in the same sentence as your gra- I can't believe--
Anyway.
And it's Christmas.
Yeah.
Don't forget what Christmas is about.
Come on, spare a thought for the under privileged people.
Yeah.
(incoherent)
Steve. Steve.
Is it Ben Kweller. Do you wanna play a bit of Ben Kweller?
I'd love a bit of Ben Kweller. I dunno, are you a fan?
I love him.
Yeah--
Yeah.
Well, this is a cracking tune and uh-
Okay.
Yeah.
And uh,I think we'll enjoy this--
Slam-dunk it. It's quirky.
Why don't we just stop and think about what we've done?
Ricky laughs. Claire joins him.
They do spend so much time in- in bed that they actually- I'm sure war will--
Ben Kweller - In Other Words
Ben Kweller, In Other Words--
That's fantastic. That ending is- oh. Go- it's like Ben Folds, bit of old Elton. That's great.
You had him in sessions, didn't you, Claire?
Yeah, in fact--
Did you meet him or did you- cause he's quite young, isn't he?
He's very young. Uhm, he came in about six months ago--
To do something for John Kennedy and uhm, and I- also a session for me and I've been repeat- I repeated it this week as the best of the sessions cause it was- he did three songs, stunning stuff.
It's just him and a piano, was it? or him and a guitar?
It was just- yeah- it was just him.
Yeah. Yeah, yeah yeah.
Him with a couple of instruments.
Mm.
Uhm, stunning and also he did uhm, he did a Dingwalls gig for Xfm listeners and uh, the reaction from the listeners phoning up trying to get tickets was incredible.
Really?
He really has touched a nerve.
Yeah.
Well, like you say Ricky, I mean, it's really--
It's great.
Yeah.
Well I've just seen- we were talking there's a kinda

Lack of music that sort of seems to be making use of instruments and sort of- and just the sound you can make with a piano and guitar and drums, do you know what I mean? It's like- it's so invigorating and you get kind of stuff like, you know, The Streets and whatever else or err- you know kind of hip hop and stuff. And in that- I love the fact that a lot of err- pleased to see Miss Dynamite on Top of the Pops last night using a live band. Really kind of- it remade her whole sort of R&B sound really exciting.
(mumbling) I like that errm- better than the other one. Yeah.
Errm- anyway that's us being muso.
That's us being terribly muso! I like that, yeah!
That's us being muso for the year.
Yeah, enough of that!
Well we are playing our favourite records. We're allowed to comment on it.
Well it's nice to be able to talk sensibly without Karl interrupting with some gibberish. I- I mean bless him!--
I- awww Karl...
I don't see it as gibberish!
No, bless him!
He's probably listening on Sky or summat.
Sky digital.
Yeah!
Yeah.
864. Channel 864, or around the world on xfm.co.uk- get that in...
Is that what you have to do? What do you do- do you just go into the website do you?
Go into the website yeah and err-
I can never get things like that to work on my computer.
Or you can go and check out the webcam obviously and errm- see me in my- camouflage gear.
They won't see you will you?
Oh they wont see me no! No.
Now- so what do you do? Just go into the website and what does it say? play live online?
Yeah, listen live.
And it's just like listening down the phone line?
Yeah.
I sound like I've come from the 1950's don't I?
(laughing) Yeah! Exactly! You've come from the 19th century. "What's this??"
Ricky laughs
I'm not very err- oh I was going to say summat then but I can't--

(laughing) Can we just very quickly before we move on though- because I'm getting very excited about the comedy awards. Now I know what you're wearing and errm- you've got a- got a table with all your mates there. Is Jonathan Ross doing it again?
Yeah, thats why--
Because he's very funny.
That's why it's my favourite, I hate- I hate awards shows- I do honestly, I hate them. But errm- but this is actually an event because it's Jonathan Ross, its just--

Well I err- I was- cause I'm talking to someone about it and I might've mentioned it before, but err- we did this award ceremony- we went to an award ceremony last year where err- it- everything was sponsored by corporate groups--
Oh yeah!
You know by businesses or by different, y'know- everything was sponsored! And I swear to god the pudding was sponsored by Electrolux.
Claire laughs
Yeah.
And I've never eaten a pudding before sponsored by anyone and err--
No.
It was, you know, it was a very odd affair that! I thought was very strange.
That's weird.

Because it seemed as though corporate people had paid for a table so that they- so when we came out someone kinda came on stage and said "well, we've got a lovely number of- a wonderful collection of celebrities here this evening."
Oh god yeah!
Do you remember??
And it was err- "please be upstanding for your chairman Tom O'Connor"... We were made to give Tom O'Connor standing ovation.
A standing ovation!
Claire laughs
That's weird.

We had to stand up so that we could give Tom O'Connor - former presenter of Crosswits - a standing ovation. We're talking about the cream of British TV Talent. Giving him a standing-- not that he doesn't deserve it! I'm sure he's a great entertainer. But I think err- sir Cliff was there wasn't he?
Seen the back of the stage this week?
I don't want to talk about it, it's too embarrassing.
Why?
Tom O'Connor's on there thanking- thanking Mel Young and the BBC for giving him a part in Doctors.
Yeah.
I love that, he had to take out a whole page.
A whole page--
Oh it was so sweet.
He'd obviously spent the fee he'd been paid for the show just to say he was pleased to be back on TV.
It was- what an advert?
Yeah.
A whole page thanking the BBC for having him back on telly.
Ricky cackles
Stop it!
But- well we're laughing! But it's gonna happen to you in about a few years time!
Exactly!
Ricky and Steve laugh
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
I was shouting that in a vain attempt to throw someone.
Ricky laughs.
And, um... it was extraordinary!
Oh.
But, I tell you, I think- 'cause I think you'd be better off, like, if they, sort of, brought back...
Bare knuckle?
Wrestling.
Wrestling. Oh, like-
Wrestling from the 70s, like Big Daddy and the Haystacks.
Wrestling would be fun!
Like Mick McManus.
Yeah, exactly!
Yes!
Oh, 'cause the-
Because I think you've got more of the physique for wrestling.
I think I'm too young for wrestling on British television!
Yeah they were always about 65 weren't they.
I think they're 58, one of 'em! Les Kellet!
Yeah.
Yeah but the outfits were fun.
Oh they're- Yeah.
Extraordinary, yeah.
Oh, bit too tight, weren't they? Some of those outfits.
Yeah, and it was always that kind of shiny... whatever proceeded Lycra.
I know... with the- just a little winkle showing.
Yeah-
Steve laughs.
His fat-
"Little winkle."
Little- Little round fat man with a little winkle in their tight shorts!
Steve laughs.
Why were you looking?
Ricky stammers.
I've done you!
Play a record!
I've done you, hang on!
I'm not- I'm not-
Claire stammers and laughs.
Well, answers please!
I'm not... I'm not one of those!
You're not looking at mine now, are you?
Yes!
Ricky and Steve giggle.
Red Hot Chilli Peppers - Zephyr Song
And those are the Red Hot Chili Peppers and they're still going strong... Mmm.
Steve chuckles
Indeed. Yes.
That's one of my favorite tunes of the year. You liked that one?
You've enjoyed that. Yes! Absolutely, yeah yeah yeah.
These are all mutual, we- we- we love them all. We're not- we're not, really-
Aboslutely, yeah, no, we're not...
We're not annoying each other by putting on songs the other one doesn't like.
Not at all. Not at all.
We're like a team today, innit? I think that's the Christmas spirit. I don't know what it is.
We've come together, we've sort of unified... Yeah.
Yeah.
Yeah, in the absence of Karl.
Yeah.
Who often divides us. He often comes between us.
Does he? Does he do that, yeah?
Like, yeah- Well I tell you what it's like. It's like, um, it's like a child. Like... it's like we're a married couple, and he's sort of our autistic child. Or something, you know.
Ah, right, yeah.
And sometimes it just puts a strain on the marriage! You know.
Ricky scoffs.
You know. And we- you know- and we- we- and all three of us love each other! You know.
But [stammering]-
Yeah, 'cause he does love you guys.
But some- Yeah, exactly. But sometimes it's hard. You know.
I know.
I- I hear him talking about you in the office sometimes, you know. He looks up to you -- he aspires to you two.
Yeah, and [unintelligible].
But, it's- it's times like this-
Yeah.
Because of- [stammering] Because of, um, to be honest, the baby Jesus...
Claire sniggers.
That we, uhm... we realized that there's beauty in everyone and it's- it's all- It's alright.
Yeah. Yeah.
And, yeah... [unintelligible]
And he's never had that before.
No.
Well I, um, I have to say, that I'm really getting into the Christmas spirit. I didn't- When I was younger, I didn't really enjoy it, I was quite cynical. I was quite, you know, rock and roll.
You're joking!

But, uh- but now I'm sort of, yeah, I walk in a department store, and if there's one of the old, you know, chestnuts a-roasting on an open fire, which uh- that classic tune. Or, uh, any of those, you know-
Oh, I thought you meant one of those old boys that stand outside the British Museum.
Right, right. Yeah.
No no no, right. You mean the tune, yeah.
Claire sniggering.
You know that one. Or, uh. Is it- how does it go? "Chestnuts roasting on an open fire,"
Chestnuts roasting on a...
Yeah.
Jack Frost,
Nipping at your nose!
Oh!
But I can't get enough of them! I- I love 'em. I'm in the department store, you know, it's frosty outside, you know, it's warm in there.
Have you ever roasted your chestnuts on an open fire?
I have never done that, no. I have not done that.
Imagine that. Just ba-
I have not done that.
Just backing up to it, like that, with your little chestnuts hanging out like a bulldog.
Steve sniggers.
What would you be wea- You would probably be just- I imagine you- you'd have your dressing gown on. You'd have just hoiked it up slightly, so your arse was showing.
Just pull it up. Pop 'em- pop 'em down- like- tuck it in like a lovely lady.
Yeah.
So you look like a lovely lady from the front, but behind...
Yeah.
It looks like a... you know, a real- a- a bulldog dragging a tree.
Yeah, exactly.
And uh- and you just pop that- you pop them in the grate.
Yeah. Yeah. And you would- 'cause you want to be careful of too much roasting.
Ricky sniggers.
So I imagine you'd wanna just, kind of-
Lightly toast 'em.
Ease yourself in slowly, like if it-
Lightly toast 'em!
And if it feels too hot-
Singe them!
Get out of there! Get the hell out of there!
Ricky and Claire sniggering.
Yeah!
You know if that's- If any kids are listening: try that!
No!
What?
Don't-
No!
Like there's a kid thinking "Yeah, I'm going to roast my chestnuts on an open fire!"
Ricky laughs.
Oh, I don't think there's even a child that's doing that!
No, I don't want someone to do it and then-
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
So, uh... um... yeah. We've had Oasis, Streets, we've had U2 -- we've had some cracking tunes. Can we get away with playing Nelly?
Hot in Here?
Yeah.

I think it's a cracking tune, I really do. I duh- I just think, again, you know, I'm not interested in what genre you think it fits into, or whether you think it's cool, or because kids like you're not supposed to like it-
Let's- Let's-
It's a good tune, and I think we should try and-
Right, just sling it here, I-I'll stick it on-
We should try and stick it in.
Let's play it.
But before that, Rick.
Go on.
Can I just play one track?
Go on.
We did play it much earlier in the year.
What? What?
It's from that album, uh, "Son of Evil Reindeer" by a band called "The Reindeer Section" and, uh, this is a cracking little tune.
Aw, Yeah.
I just think it's beautiful and, um, nice to hear it.
Oh "it's beautiful" marry it then.
Steve scoffs
Grand Parade - The Reindeer Section#
Aw.
Nice, isn't it?
Yeah.
Very christmassy.
It's beautiful.
It makes me want, uh, to wish everyone a happy Christmas.
Indeed.
You know what I mean?
Yeah, well, do it.
No.
No? Okay.
Steve Laughs
Uh, that's called "Grand Parade"...
Ricky Sniggers
From the album Son of Evil Reindeer by The Reindeer Section -- it's a nice tune, it's one of my favorites of the year.
Thanks for the tea, by the way, Steve.
Not at all. No, it's- that's- that's my pleasure. It's my pleasure... Um, Claire.
Mm?
Just big highlights of the year for you? As a final round up.
"Highlights of the year"? Umm...
Sort of things have you enjoyed this year? I mean musically, maybe. Or maybe stuff you've- you know.
Musically? Um... I've enjoyed that band "The Music".
Okay.
Um, and "The Rapture".
Sure.
And, uh, "The Electric Six" - remember last time, I sat in for Karl, we played, uh, "Danger, Danger, High Voltage".
Yeah.
And it w- like, one of the first times-
That was first time I heard it, you played that. Yeah.
A-and now we- we're playing it every hour.
Really?
And-
Because you're ki- You're- You're sort of a pioneer, aren't you, musically, on Xfm.
Well I-
You're one of the people who keeps it pretty raw, pretty cutting edge.
I remember the- the early days of "Idlewild". Ricky, do you remember the early days of Idlewild?
I- I- I take that back as well!
All those years ago?
Teasing you about them playing the [unintelligible] and stuff.
I know!
That- that latest single I love! And the video's great as well!
Yeah. Yeah.
I'm a big fan of Idlewild now.
I knew you- you-
No, great, brilliant.
You'd like 'em, yeah.
Come around in the end, yeah.
Yeah.
Yeah, yeah.
So, yeah, it's been a good year. I haven't been out to many gigs, obviously.
Sure.
Because I do the evening show.
Yeah. Yeah.
But, you know, all the sessions. Wh- which I'm doing the best of next week. Quick plug...
Uh huh.
For the show next week.
Yep.
Best of the sessions. So yeah it's been a good year.
Low points? Low points? What don't you...
Low points?
Claire exhales.
Do you know what mine are?
What?
Poverty, and war and everything.
Oh, I always hate it.
Oh, well obviously, yeah, that!
I always hate it.
No! No, you didn't say that!
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.
No you were- you were gonna say-
I-I was gonna say. Um.
No, you were gonna say "The Streets" or sommat.
Claire stammers.
Yeah.
And I- And you didn't care about...
Yeah.
Claire laughs.
All of the people dying. So.
Yeah!
Don't try and do it now, Sturgess.
I'm thinking specifically of-
You're nasty! You like that! You like poverty?
Claire laughs.
Oh, you like poverty and starvation? Play a record, Claire, because you've embarrassed yourself!
That's interesting! That's interesting!
What a horrible...
Near Christmas time!
What a horrible hoe.
You- You hope kids go lame?
Oh my god just- You're evil!
Oh god!
You're evil!
That's terrible! That's terrible thing, Claire!
Ricky giggles.
Nelly - Hot in Here
Nelly. Hot in Here.
Cheeky little bit of Nelly there, on XFM 104.9.
Oh we've snuck out- Nelly in! But, uh-
We don't care. Springsteen and Nelly?
Ah, it's a great tune. A great tune.
You don't get that on... XFM, do you? D'ya? Usually?
No. No, indeed.
We don't live by the rules, Steve.
Absolutely! I was lis- As I was listening to you, then, talk.
You got bored?
No, no, no! It reminded me of an E-mail that someone sent in, saying that they listen online.
Yeah.
But, uh, because of however slow their computer is, or whatever, um, they- it kind of stutters all the way through. Um-
Ricky sniggers.
You want to point out that is the way I talk?
But- No- But they've said: it only happens when you talk.
Ricky laughs.
And, uh, I think they've correctly identified that it's not the computer at fault. You do sound like someone...
Well, that's why I wasn't worried about doing this boxing match! 'Cause I've definitely lost my looks, and I already slur.
Yes.
So there was really no, ruh-, danger of any damage!
No, exactly. Yeah. You do sound punch drunk con- constantly!
Ricky laughs.
Exactly yeah.
Well that's just part of your charm.
Well listen. That's been a lovely two hours for me. I've enjoyed it. I hope the listeners have enjoyed it. I hope you've enjoyed it. I hope Sturgess enjoyed it.
I've enjoyed it yeah.
Well, I didn't really care if you enjoyed it to be honest, so don't butt in when I'm talking to Steve. Yeah, you know, or you won't do it again.
You're here to press the buttons, Sturgess.
Yeah. But, um, we're going to play now a Christmas song for the lovely Christmas ladies.
I don't say it's so much Christmasy, but it's one of the tunes I've heard this year that really stuck out to me.
Well I'm trying to tie it into the festive theme, so.
Well, you're a fool. You've embarrassed yourself. You've just shown off that there's no planning.
Yeah.

This is, er, it was given away on a free CD on the cover of a magazine. I just think it's brilliant. It's Lamb Chop, who are an excellent band always, doing a cover of an obscure Rolling Stones tune called Backstreet Girl.
And I'll tell you what. A bloody good meal as well.
That's true enough. Um, so we'll leave them with this. It's Backstreet Girl, Lamb Chop, and see you next week for our final festive show.
"Lamb Chop"
Yeah thank you very much.
Embarrassing. Sometimes you're embarrassing, thank you.
♫ I don't want you to be high. ♫

synopsis.description: According to Pilkipedia, this is the song being played. (http://www.pilkipedia.co.uk/wiki/index.php?title=14_December_2002) I can't confirm that against the version on YouTube, but maybe this is a radio edit? No clue. Sorry.
Karl is Ricky and Steve's child
Roasting your chestnuts on an open fire.
Ricky wishes everyone a happy Christmas
Highlights of the year. Claire is a pioneer.
Ricky and Steve hate poverty and war. Claire likes it!
Ricky makes a listener believe their computer is broken.
